newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lufthansa staff stage 2-hour strike at airports.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa staff stage 2-hour strike at airports.

text.p: German national airline Deutsche Lufthansa said on Monday there could be some delays to its flights because of a two-hour strike by ground staff as well as flight crews in a wage dispute.
German white-collar trade union DAG, or Deutsche Angesellten-Gewerkschaft, said it had called a strike by Lufthansa employees at Frankfurt, Munich and Hamburg airports between 0600 GMT and 0800 GMT.
The DAG had warned on Friday it planned "limited industrial action" after Lufthansa refused to meet its demand for a four percent wage increase in talks that collapsed last month.
A spokesman for Lufthansa said there could be delays to flights because of the strikes but was unable to give details.
It was not immediately clear how many staff were taking part in the strikes.
"With this industrial action we want to make Lufthansa's management put a better offer on the table in wage talks," DAG chief negotiator Michael Tarp said in a statement.
A DAG spokesman said no further strikes had been scheduled yet.
